headline: Stephens cuts payment stock rating
summary: Investing.com -- Though financial technology sector enters 2025 with a generally positive outlook, supported by macroeconomic support and trends in payment digitization, analysts warn of “normalized” returns following outsized gains in 2024, driven by multiple expansions across growth and transaction processing stocks.

raw.headline: Stephens cuts payment stock rating
raw.summary: Investing.com -- Though financial technology sector enters 2025 with a generally positive outlook, supported by macroeconomic support and trends in payment digitization, analysts warn of “normalized” returns following outsized gains in 2024, driven by multiple expansions across growth and transaction processing stocks.

headline: Global Payments downgraded to Neutral from Buy at Goldman Sachs
summary: Goldman Sachs analyst Will Nance downgraded Global Payments (GPN) to Neutral from Buy with a price target of $122, down from $155. The company has already telegraphed an underlying deceleration in revenue growth in 2025 as a result of restructuring its go-to-market and the firm believes Global Payments’ consensus revenue estimates are likely to be revised downward as the company executes on its strategy of completing several divestitures while also re-aligning, the analyst tells investors. Publi
